intro: Araeococcus montanus, commonly known as the mountain areocaule, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its compact growth habit and ornamental appearance make it a sought-after species in horticulture. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often cultivated in controlled environments.
